intro: Nothaphoebe alpigena, commonly known as the alpine nothaphoebe, is a member of the Lauraceae family and is native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree or shrub, typically found in cloud forests and high-altitude environments. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit with smooth, dark green leaves that are elliptical in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered, and it produces berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
